entry.title: ç¬¬åä¸‰ã€åå››å‘¨ ä»å¥ ï¼ˆ2ï¼‰
entry.content:
è½¬è½½è‡ªhttps://www.wangkebaohe.com ä¾µåˆ 

True or false

1ã€I had the breakfast and I sent the children to school.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šé”™è¯¯

2ã€I returned home but it was still early.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šé”™è¯¯

3ã€A smiling policeman told him and his bicycle had been found.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šé”™è¯¯

4ã€The weather was very hot so he carried the bed on to the roof of his house.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šæ­£ç¡®

5ã€Over the years, the crash was forgotten when the wreck remained undisturbed.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šé”™è¯¯

6ã€The plane was late and detectives were waiting at the airport all morning.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šæ­£ç¡®

7ã€Nearly everybody enters for the competition each year, but Linda wins every time.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šæ­£ç¡®

8ã€When he smiled, he remembered his hard early years and the long road to success.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šé”™è¯¯

9ã€We all have secrets, but we do not want even our closest friends to learn.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šé”™è¯¯

10ã€Donâ€™t stay up too late is a good living habit.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šé”™è¯¯

11ã€It is said that if anyone touches the tree, he or she will have bad luck.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šæ­£ç¡®

12ã€There is needed that kind of capacity to cope with the problem.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šé”™è¯¯

13ã€In order to keep close relationship between friends is to pay respect to each other.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šé”™è¯¯

14ã€If two men whose interests are the same, they can make good friends.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šé”™è¯¯

15ã€Though the sound could be heard clearly, it took me a long time to react.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šæ­£ç¡®

Passage rewriting

1ã€Not long ago, on the Aegean island of Kea, archaeologists made an interesting discovery. There was a temple in an ancient city on the promontory of Ayia Irini. An American team explored it. The city must be prosperous for a period of time. It once had a high level of civilization. Houses generally had three storeys high. They were made of stone. Rooms inside were very big. Walls were decorated beautifully. The city even laid out a drainage system. Under the narrow streets, people found a lot of pipes. They were made of earth. The archaeologists explored the temple. People used the temple for prey and worship from the fifteenth century B.C. to Roman times. In the most holy room of the temple, people found pieces of fifteen statues. They all were made of earth. Each of them stood for a goddess. Once they were painted.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šè¯„åˆ†æ€»çš„è§„åˆ™ï¼š ä¸»è¯­é€‰æ‹©æ­£ç¡®ï¼Œå¯å¾—3åˆ†ã€‚ ä¸»å¥é€‰æ‹©æ­£ç¡®ï¼Œå¯å¾—3åˆ†ã€‚ ä¸»å¥ä¸ä¸»å¥ä¹‹é—´å…³ç³»æ­£ç¡®ï¼Œåˆä¹é€»è¾‘ï¼Œå¯å¾—4åˆ†ã€‚ å…¶ä½™å¯é…Œæƒ…å¢å‡åˆ†ã€‚

Sentence Combining

1ã€My advice is this. You practice speaking English. You should do as often as possible.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šMy advice is you should practice speaking English as often as possible.

2ã€You are coming to London. That is the best news. I have heard some news recently.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šThat you are coming to London is the best news that I have heard recently.

3ã€Fashion differs from country to country. That may reflect the differences. The differences are of culture. The reflection is from one aspect.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šThar fashion differs from country to country may reflect the differences of culture from one aspect.

4ã€The curious thing was this. The lake was not marked. It was not on the map.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šThe curious thing was that the lake was not marked on the map.

5ã€What invariably happens? The question is this. A great number of things choose to go wrong. They occur at precisely the same moment.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šWhat invariably happens is that a great number of things choose to go wrong at precisely the same moment.

6ã€One of the boxes was extremely heavy. No one could account for the fact.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šNo one could account for the fact that one of the boxes was extremely heavy. .

7ã€Experts confirmed this. A puma is cornered. It will attack a human being.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šExperts confirmed that a puma will attack a human being if it is cornered.

8ã€I rang the bell. I was not surprised to see this. Mr. Smith was still as fat as ever.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šI rang the bell and was not surprised to see that Mr. Smith was still as fat as ever. or After I rang the bell, I was not surprised to see that Mr. Smith was still as fat as ever.

9ã€The wallet must have been found by one of the villagers. Sam was sure of that. It was no returned to him.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šSam was sure that the wallet must have been found by one of the villagers, but it was no returned to him.

10ã€People work in offices. They are frequently referred to as â€œwhite-collar workersâ€™. That is for the simple reason. The reason is this. They usually wear a collar and tie to go to work.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šPeople who work in offices are frequently referred to as â€œwhite-collar workersâ€™ for the simple reason that they usually wear a collar and tie to go to work.

entry.title: ç¬¬åä¸€ã€åäºŒå‘¨ ä»å¥ ï¼ˆ1ï¼‰
entry.content:
è½¬è½½è‡ªhttps://www.wangkebaohe.com ä¾µåˆ 

ç¬¬å…­è®² ä»å¥ ï¼ˆ1ï¼‰ Clauses (1)

True or false

1ã€He has finished her homework before he went to bed.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šé”™è¯¯

2ã€Anybody, either a firm or an individual, have a chance to open a current account.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šé”™è¯¯

3ã€Neither volleyball nor basketball is a hundred years old.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šæ­£ç¡®

4ã€Not only you but (also) I am to blame.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šæ­£ç¡®

5ã€There are an ocean of flowers.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šé”™è¯¯

6ã€At present, there is a lot of pilot projects in the whole country in every large telecommunication operator.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šé”™è¯¯

7ã€The great majority of the people behave according to the law rule.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šæ­£ç¡®

8ã€The audience was impressed by his profound lecture.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šé”™è¯¯

9ã€A small fishing boat was carried miles out to sea by the powerful fish.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šæ­£ç¡®

10ã€I used to travel by air a great deal when I was a boy.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šæ­£ç¡®

11ã€There he was picked up by policeman and sent back to theEnglandby local authorities.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šé”™è¯¯

12ã€In 1860, a better plan was put forward by an Englishman, William Low.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šæ­£ç¡®

13ã€As soon as he opens the gate from the outside, he comes into the garden and waits until the gate shuts.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šæ­£ç¡®

14ã€Children were at school, my husband was at work and the house was quiet.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šæ­£ç¡®

15ã€He slept very well for first two nights, but on third night, storm blew up.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šé”™è¯¯

Passage rewriting

1ã€Titanic was a great ship. On April 10th, 1912, it sailed for New York from Southampton. 1,316 passengers and 891 crew were on the ship. It had 46,000 ton. Even by modern standard, it was a huge one. People had built many ships. Titanic was the largest ship at that time. They thought it unsinkable. She had sixteen watertight compartments. Two of these were filled with water. It could still float. People will always remember the terrible sinking of the great ship. It sank on its first voyage. Life lost heavily. Many people jumped into the water. The water was icy. Not enough lifeboats for all passengers. 1,500 people died.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šè¯„åˆ†æ€»çš„è§„åˆ™ï¼š ä¸»è¯­é€‰æ‹©æ­£ç¡®ï¼Œå¯å¾—3åˆ†ã€‚ ä¸»å¥é€‰æ‹©æ­£ç¡®ï¼Œå¯å¾—3åˆ†ã€‚ ä¸»å¥ä¸ä¸»å¥ä¹‹é—´å…³ç³»æ­£ç¡®ï¼Œåˆä¹é€»è¾‘ï¼Œå¯å¾—4åˆ†ã€‚ å…¶ä½™å¯é…Œæƒ…å¢å‡åˆ†ã€‚

Sentence Combining

1ã€The big clock used to strike the hours day and night. It was damaged many years ago.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šThe big which/that clock used to strike the hours day and night was damaged many years ago.

2ã€A man broke his right leg. People took him to hospital. It happened a few weeks before Christmas.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šA man who broke his right leg was taken to hospital a few weeks before Christmas.

3ã€A desert island is a sort of paradise. There the sun always shines. We sometimes imagine so.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šWe sometimes imagine that a desert island is a sort of paradise where the sun always shines.

4ã€I bought a book of maps. I found it most helpful. It is helpful on the journey. The journey is cross country.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šI bought a book of maps, which I found most helpful on the journey cross country.

5ã€People work in offices. They are frequently referred to as â€œwhite-collar workersâ€™. They usually wear a collar to go to work. They usually wear a tie to go to work

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šPeople who work in offices are frequently referred to as â€œwhite-collar workersâ€™ because they usually wear a collar and a tie to go to work.

6ã€The teacher explained that passage. He did that again and again. Every student might understand it.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šThe teacher explained that passage again and again so that every student might understand it. or In order that every student might understand it, the teacher explained that passage again and again.

7ã€The officer heard the news. The officer was in the control tower. He was very angry. Balloons can be a great danger. The danger is to aircraft.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šThe officer in the control tower was very angry when they heard the news, because balloons can be a great danger to aircraft.

8ã€The man slept on the floor. He was tired of that. He saved up for years. He wanted to buy a real bed.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šThe man was tired of sleeping on the floor so that he saved up for years to buy a real bed. or Because he was tired of sleeping on the floor, the man saved up for years to buy a real bed.

9ã€This time, he managed to climb into the mouth of the volcano. He could take photographs. He could measure temperatures.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šThis time, he managed to climb into the mouth of the volcano so that he could take photographs and measure temperatures.

10ã€Someone gave the alarm. The great ship turned. The turning is sharp. The ship wanted to avoid a collision. A collision was direct.

æ­£ç¡®ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šAfter the alarm had been given, the great ship turned sharply to avoid a direct collision.
